Class GridMap

java.lang.Object
  GridMap

public class GridMap
extends java.lang.Object

This class creates a map using a 2D array data structure; the assignment specifies that the grid has ny rows and nx columns and each element is referred to by (nx,ny), the rows range from 1 to ny and the columns range from 1 to nx, and that the grid "starts" at the bottom left corner so that the element at column 1 and row 1 is in the bottom left corner.

Version:
(a version number or a date)
Author:
(your name)

          Constructor where a map can be created from a given number of input columns and rows.
 
Method Summary
 int getCol(int ncol)
          This method returns the column of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.
 int getDryNeighbors(int row2, int col2)
          This method returns the number of dry squares adjacent to the square at map[row][col]
 int getRow(int nrow)
          This method returns the row of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.
 boolean isDry(int col, int row)
          This method returns true if the square is dry land.

Method Detail

getCol

public int getCol(int ncol)
This method returns the column of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.

Parameters:
ncol - The row of the element in the map.

getDryNeighbors

public int getDryNeighbors(int row2,
                           int col2)
This method returns the number of dry squares adjacent to the square at map[row][col]

Parameters:
row - The row of the square.
col - The column of the square.
Returns:
The number of dry neighbors

getRow

public int getRow(int nrow)
This method returns the row of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.

Parameters:
nrow - The row of the element in the map.

isDry

public boolean isDry(int col,
                     int row)
This method returns true if the square is dry land.

Parameters:
row - The row of the square.
col - The column of the square.
Returns:
True is the neighbor is dry.
